posts.title: The sun could fit into Jupiter's magnetosphere
posts.content: Jupiter is one of the more amazing places in the Solar System, with enough space to accommodate 1,400 Earths. In the Solar System, the only thing bigger than Jupiter is the sun. However its magnetosphere is the solar system's largest, even bigger than the sun himself. The magnetosphere of Jupiter is in fact so large that it fits the sun.

posts.title: Curiosities of the Blue Whale
posts.content: The heart of a blue whale is the size of a Mini Cooper, and the heart of an adult whale can weigh about 900 kilos. Just beats once every ten seconds and can be heard from three miles away. An agile person could crawl through the main arteries.

posts.title: Did you know that ...?
posts.content: 1. In the oceans there is enough gold to go around two pounds every inhabitant of the planet. 2. 95% of matter in the universe is invisible. 3. People blink over 10,000 times a day. 4. Humans share more than half of our genes with slugs. 5. The temperature on Earth increases slightly during the full moon.
